headline: Simone Biles Withdraws From Floor Event Finals
dek: Simone Biles has taken time for her mental health and to recover from the "twisties."

comments.name: Donna Montalbano
comments.text: She seems unable to make a clean break and keeps  postponing the inevitable, just to be Olympics-adjacent. She should just go home and be with her family. Truly sad.

child.name: Patrick Shaw
child.text:
It happens in sports. Mind and body are not in sync. As a gymnist she could be coming to the end of her career.

That's why I can't understand where the hate is coming from. Great athletes make it look easy so people don't see them as human. In their minds' they think, you're too gifted, walk it off.

She could seriously hurt herself if she's not healthy all around and also jeopardize the team standings.

Go home, she earned her spot and deserves to be there in a motivational capacity.

child.name: Tee Archer
child.text: There's No hate just questions like making the trip in the first place. Did she, her coach or team not know of her affliction prior to leaving the US?  If not, they should have.

child.name: BlueFlame
child.text: So you think it’s better she goes home and mope on the couch with family instead of staying and supporting her team. Lol. How absurd. The fact she’s not proves she’s not the one with a quitter’s mindset, you are.

comments.name: JOHN ELLIS
comments.text: The BALANCE beam is more dangerous than the floor exercise, why is she waiting?  - drop out now.  All she's doing now is sowing anxiety amongst the rest of the team.

child.name: Gigi Woodlawn
child.text: She's also making it so that another athlete is waiting on her to make up her mind so they don't know if they'll compete or not.

child.name: Kirian Dass
child.text: She’s afraid she’ll do more unGOATlike things  and some people might not give her a standing ovation after
This comment violated our policy

comments.name: udi BEHR
comments.text: Enough! Stop covering Biles - she didn't show up. We should focus on the winner and all the athletes that did show up.

comments.name: Grace Fury
comments.text: She should be on a plane headed home to take care of her mental breakdown. That would set a respectful example. It's either serious or it isn't. If she were to enter this last one and win, the whole excuse is going to look flimsy/more questionable (and of course we'll never hear the end of it - This year's Olympics will be all about Biles, the brave comeback - for one event). But, I think this daily suspense thing is already making a joke of it, as she's apparently still well enough to soak up all of the attention and to "play around with" the idea of competing in an Olympic event. She needs to move on - We need to move on.

comments.name: Howie Doin
comments.text: "How to Quit on Your Team, Deny Another Girl the Right to Compete in the Olympics, and Still be Called a Hero" by Simon Biles.

comments.name: Tee Archer
comments.text: Why did she even bother making the trip to Japan? Her fragile psychic weakness has cost her teammates as she took the place of others who would have given their eye teeth to compete.

child.name: BlueFlame
child.text: You seem to think problems only arise when they’re convenient.

child.name: Allen Snyder
child.text: Why did you bother to comment when you have nothing of interest yo say??

child.name: JOHN ELLIS
child.text: That's fine that it happens but 3 things I know for certain 1.  If you are ill or injured, you're taken off the roster.  2.  THERE IS STILL NO "I" in team and 3.  If your pitching ace is giving up hits - you take them out of the game.  The coach should have recognized her problem and at very minimum "asked" her to drop out.
This comment violated our policy

child.name: BlueFlame
child.text: The troIIsknow all that. They don’t care. The only thing that matters to them is whining and moaning about people who have made real accomplishments in life. It’s like a pacifier for Iosers.

child.name: Free Wheelin201
child.text: Be nice.. She has mental issues.

comments.name: Lachlan Connor
comments.text: She should go home and let the spotlight fall upon the ladies doing the hard stuff. She can cheerlead from the comforts of her own home and not be a constant distraction.

child.text: This comment violated our policy

comments.name: Joe Palooka
comments.text: Simone showed a lot of courage being a spectator when spectators were banned from attending.
This comment violated our policy

child.text: This comment violated our policy

comments.name: Mary Morris
comments.text: I feel so sorry for Simone. She certainly worked hard to be able to go to the Olympics and not being able to compete must be a great let down for her. She still is a champ in my book.

comments.name: kathy rayborn
comments.text: Simone, no one owns you. Your only obligation is to yourself and those you love. You publicly spoke truth to justice and became a victor, not a victim. I could never expect to have an Olympic medal around my neck, but like you, I looked a monster in the eyes and my words destroyed his freedom forever. We are members of a team that we never wanted to be on. But our bravery saved us and thousands like us. And that is worth it’s weight in gold. So thank you Simone, you are a warrior forevermore.

child.name: Louis Weeks
child.text:
She made a commitment, you have any6 idea how many other young women wanted her spot?

She beat all those other women out and when she got there, she promptly gave up.

I feel enormous amounts of compassion for her pain, but if she was still actively in distress, why not stay home and let others carry the torch and cheer them on and support them as a spectator?

Remember, part of the Olympic events is teamwork, being there to compete and support and inspire the other members as well as representing America as a whole.
This comment violated our policy

comments.name: BlueFlame
comments.text: You’re going to be rather disappointed when she gains endorsements because she’s raising awareness on mental health. But I’m sure you’ll find another successful person to whine and complain about.

child.name: BlueFlame
child.text: You’re going to be rather disappointed when she gains endorsements because she’s raising awareness on mental health. But I’m sure you’ll find another successful person to whine and complain about.

comments.name: christopher Carroll
comments.text: GOAT.   Pfffft.  Champions rise above.

comments.name: Steve Mullen
comments.text: Maybe she thought the Olympics were getting canceled and didn't train...who knows. But I am not buying her mental health story.

child.text: This comment violated our policy

comments.name: Son of Son of Steve The Progressive
comments.text: What is the opposite of "champion"??? 🤔🤔🤔

child.text:
You. 

That was far too easy. Try harder.

comments.name: julie butler
comments.text: I just want her to be happy, well, and have another career that will sustain her

child.name: Kirian Dass
child.text: She’s a millionaire celebrity. She’ll be just fine

comments.name: Left Curve
comments.text: When the going gets tough...

child.name: Harrison Bergeron
child.text: When you are physically unable to know where you are in your flips it's not as simple as you make it out to be.

child.name: Kirian Dass
child.text: But I thought she was the Goat?

child.name: Howie Doin
child.text: This problem magically appeared in the middle of the Olympics? I have some ocean front property to sell you in Kansas.

child.text: You say from your couch with chip crumbs on your shirt.

child.name: Left Curve
child.text: Nah, it's too early in the day to be hitting the chips.

comments.name: Jake Johannsen
comments.text: Get on a plane and go home.  You're nothing but a distraction from those who actually want to be there.

comments.name: John Creel
comments.text: Being a loser is better than being a quitter. At least a loser tries.

child.text: This comment violated our policy

comments.name: Brenda Lott
comments.text: It would be helpful to repost the story of Elena Mukhina. When mind and body are not in sync, 10 feet off the ground is not the place to be

child.name: Jon Jones
child.text: Right…has nothing to do with Soviet Russia forcing the girl to remove her cast and proceed to do a move she knew would result in a broken neck. Totally similar situations. 🙄

comments.name: Frank Lee
comments.text: It could be that Prince Harry has impressed upon her mind that mental health is important for wellbeing.

comments.name: Mary Swanson
comments.text: She is a hero to so many of us.  We all love you unconditionally

child.name: Kirian Dass
child.text:
Who is “we all?”
Not me 
I don’t waste my love on millionaire celebrities I’ve never met

child.text: Donald Trump?

comments.name: Kirian Dass
comments.text:
You just know she’s gonna get a spot on The View next month then get her own Talk Show that will run for 18 years. At first everybody will love her but when she’s 40 her employees will go online and trash her and Alphas will think she’s old and corny and remember that she became famous for choking and quitting at the Olympics 

History tends to repeat itself

comments.name: Son of Son of Steve The Progressive
comments.text: I wonder if Simone Biles had those cute lil' goats embroidered on ALL of her outfits???  I could see that getting a little embarrassing after awhile!!!! 🤔🤔🤔

comments.name: Allen Snyder
comments.text: And when will you be competing??  That's what I thought.
